name: The Leeway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was one of our return visits, but we took our sister and husband for the first time.
reviews.title: Another great break at a top B&B.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They were most impressed and said Karen and Garry thought of everything down to the finest detail.
reviews.title: More than a Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely be going again and no doubt taking others with us.
reviews.title: Sheer luxury by the seaside!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is lovely and well cooked and sets you up for the day.
reviews.title: Excellent, could not fault.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The rooms are tastefully decorated and the beds very comfortable.
reviews.title: B&B or Guesthouse? The Leeway is up to Hotel Standards! with Better Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to stay in a really comfortable,clean and welcoming place look no further.From the moment you arrive you are made to feel important. I applaud the service which i'm sure would be very hard to beat .This is undoubtably the best guesthouse we have stayed in and rest assured we will be back Thank you
reviews.title: An excellent B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Leeway was perfect for our first wedding anniversary getaway our hosts Karen and Gary made us so, so welcome on our arrival and left us a bottle of rose in our room which we though was a kind and thoughtful touch. They couldn't do enough for us during our stay. We'd definatly stay with them again the room were pristine and kept immaculate their home is a credit to them and we'd strongly recommend it to anyone visiting Whitby looking for some where to stay. Thank you from James & Caroline Hutchison from Stoke on Trent
reviews.title: Karen & Gary were perfect hosts when we stayed with them at their guest house 'The Leeway', Whitby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our first time in Whitby and after reading the excellent reviews we decided to book The Leeway. We were not disappointed, on arrival we were greeted with tea and carrot cake (which was very yummy) and made to feel very welcome. We were given a guide book with a map of the area and ideas regarding where to eat.
reviews.title: What a good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very clean and comfy with a drinks machine, bathrobes and some very nice toiletries for us to use. Breakfast was extremely tasty, my husband said it was the best cooked breakfast he'd every had !!
reviews.title: what a fabulous place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking was a bit tricky, but we were expecting this. We had to park a few streets away but were able to move a lot closer later on in the evening.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Very friendly and welcoming owners. Our room (1) was clean, comfortable and well appointed. The tassimo drinks machine made great tea and coffee. (I am thinking of buying one!), the bed was very comfortable and the room quiet. Toiletries provided were good and the shower nice and powerful.
reviews.title: Everything we wanted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was delicious and plentiful in a bright dining room.
reviews.title: bed and breakfast not to be missed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hope to stay again and would recommend The Leeway to anyone needing a place in Whitby.
reviews.title: AGAIN - EXCELLENT !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed at the Leeways for the second time for the regatta weekend.Gary and Karen were there with the usual welcome,fresh coffee and cake.Rooms are lovely and the breakfast as is as good as you can get.This year we were offered a special each day,my partner had smoked salmon and scrambled egg one morning,corned beef hash another. Cant wait to go back,hopefully next year.book early as they are always busy,you will be not be disappointed.
reviews.title: The best B&B we have visited

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Visited The Leeway for the 2nd time this year and this is the best Guest House we have visited - anywhere! Greeted with the fab home-made cake and coffee as usual - much needed after a long hot journey. The rooms are extremely clean and beautifully furnished with extras such as the Tassimo Coffee Machine and I-Pod Dock. A short 5 minute walk and your in the town! The 'Daily Specials' for breakfast are a must as they are wonderful.... We had ( between us ) the Fish cake, Creamed Mushrooms and Eggs Benedict.... Thanks for a wonderful 2 nights Garry/Karen.....
reviews.title: Leeway leads the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sure, all the things other reviewers have said about this bed and breakfast are true. It is well located, the rooms are very nice, the owners are attentive and personable and the price is pretty reasonable (although not cheap).
reviews.title: The little things are the big things...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the real charm of this place lies elsewhere. The above I would expect as a minimum from a bed and breakfast. Where this little gem excels is in the finer detail. When we arrived for check-in (after being about 5 hours late) we were greeted with a fresh coffee and a slice of homemade cake - perfect. One morning we mentioned to the owners that we were celebrating a new job whilst we were there and asked if we could store a bottle of champagne in their fridge (which, of course, was no problem). When we returned to the room in the evening they had swapped the wine glasses in our room for champagne flutes.
reviews.title: Modern, well placed, friendly and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like I said, small things - but in my view it is these things that matter and make a place worth returning to.
reviews.title: Great hosts; great breakfasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very pleasant bed & breakfast with excellent facilities, helpful owners and lovely breakfasts. We will return.
reviews.title: Like a top class hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great spot just off Skinner Street, close to some excellent restaurants inc 'Ditto'
reviews.title: perfect

description: The Leeway is a relaxed, informal bolthole just a few minutes walk away from Whitby harbour, seafront, shops and restaurants. Our own special brand of friendly smiling and unstuffy service will help make your stay a memorable one.Set in a classic Victorian Terrace House, The Leeway is decorated and furnished in a contemporary style without a hint of chintz.
